intro: Hammatolobium graecum, commonly known as the Greek spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. It produces a milky sap that can be toxic if ingested. Hammatolobium graecum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
